data.text: @FlossAus or muffled.....yeah. they need to be taken seriously.....some are not broken laws yet they seriously hinder the lives they effect,
@FlossAus they don't run around in pink vagina hats demanding change either.

@leslymill That’s where we might disagree - I believe the #MeToo women have every right aggressively pursue change, after the system has denied change for so long. There will be uncomfortable conversations, yes - but there have been silence for too long.

@FlossAus The #MeToo women are on a political pilgrimage to change our cultural definition of femininity..etc. A goal of any understanding moderate is to prevent the cultural Marxism that may ensue. I share some of your concern.

@silus_2000 Sure, distinction is important but my original point was not about concealment but I think it's rubbish that Meryl is being targeted and men, who all did know, are not receiving the same treatment. Where is Ben's poster? Brad's?

@FlossAus It was a story told to him second hand years later. When people say "he/she knew", the implication is that they purposefully concealed it. That is not the case here, and that is an important distinction.

Also, when it did happen, Brad Pitt did challenge HW.

@leslymill Okay, I understand now and you're right she has a massive blind spot in Roman's case. I don't absolve her of that at all, but I do question why men in the industry don't encounter the same attacks of knowledge guilt that women seem to
@silus_2000 Damon has far more evidence of knowledge against him that Meryl, which he himself acknowledges.

@silus_2000 To be specific then, Damon acknowledged that the Gwyneth story of Harvey sexual harassing her, touching her inappropriately was one he knew of. That is a criminal act that due to HW's position of power and control of the industry went unchallenged.
@FlossAus This is true, but both have negligible amounts of evidence against them. Also, Matt Damon wasn't called out by another woman for "dereliction of duty "

@FlossAus "Behavior"?  We are in a discussion about something very very specific. So going vague is a cop out. The fact is he did not know Weinstein was, essentially, a criminal. Damon acknowledged he was a womanizer and overall pos. That's it
@leslymill Can you explain your point further, I'm not sure I understand what you mean? Also, who was convicted of pedophile rape?
@FlossAus she promoted those men's careers....heavily even after convicted pedophile rape

@silus_2000 Bringing him up in reference to Streep is showcasing the uneven standard of blame the industry is currently caught in. Streep has less evidence of knowledge on the record than Damon and Co, yet is targeted by a paid advertising campaign.
@silus_2000 Matt Damon has explicitly said in interviews that he was aware of Harvey's behavior based on discussion he had with Ben Affleck about then girlfriend Gwyneth's experience with him.

@FlossAus When you gloss over evidence, you tend to miss a lot.  That's why you always start there. Your claim that Matt Damon admitted he knew is false.  And so defending Streep by bringing him up accomplishes nothing.

@silus_2000 Why? Those posters give no such statement of evidence to say she knew. My point in discussing Meryl's "knowledge" is others actually knew and are not on the end of a paid campaign about their guilt.
@FlossAus Your first argument should have been that there is no evidence that she did know.
